Articles.Content:
Ha I messed up enough times with the first implementation. Think I hit my quota. Just due to the weird angles of the windows I couldn't find a good spot for one. You can however double click on the screens above TARS (or SCOTT) and get a backwards facing view of the cabin.

I was thinking about that, but then you wouldn't be able to get the kerbals out while it's docked.

You can transfer the crew.
I made a video for this and a planet pack.

I made a video for this and a planet pack.

When I click on the video it says it is unavailable and it isn't even on your YouTube channel. Are you aware of this?

Nevermind! It works! Great vids!

Edited February 17, 2015 by Thomas988

I made a video for this and a planet pack.

Cool video!

When I click on the video it says it is unavailable and it isn't even on your YouTube channel. Are you aware of this?

It's finished processing now...
When will the Ranger get included in 0.3.0?

Tomorrow most likely. Just need to iron out some issues with the Lander IVA and then I'll put together a release!

Nice video Augustus! Nice to see the Ranger in action!
What are you going to do next after this whole mod is done?
Probably nothing for a while since I have exams soon, so I should probably give KSP a rest for a while. But after then... who knows?

Probably nothing for a while since I have exams soon, so I should probably give KSP a rest for a while. But after then... who knows?

Until 1.0 comes out...

this is so cool great work guys!

hey Ben mind if i try to make the IVA for the command module of the endurance?
Well you could always try the Spoiler Ships.

Do not go gentle into that goodnight

- - - Updated - - -

Check to make sure that their object scaling isn't negative in blender. And tick 'write normals' too.

And thanks CaptRobau! OPM is awesome!

Thanks.
I was wondering how everyone is assembling the ship. Are you loading all the crafts into the vab or are you docking them in space?

I was wondering how everyone is assembling the ship. Are you loading all the crafts into the vab or are you docking them in space?

In my time of using this mod I just built it all in the VAB and HyperEdited it into orbit.

In my time of using this mod I just built it all in the VAB and HyperEdited it into orbit.

I launched everything and docked it.

Unfortunately MechJeb finds it very hard to dock the Landers and the second Ranger.

Unfortunately MechJeb finds it very hard to dock the Landers and the second Ranger.

Only former engineer kerbonauts that have been hired for the second time can dock that stuff.

Do not go gentle into that goodnight

http://i.imgur.com/zUJSDGz.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/DmMfZBv.jpg

It's sad nobody likes my pictures

I like your pictures.

There has that settled your insecurities?

Now all the ranger needs (for me) is the realistic exhaust (or lack thereof).

I would recommend launching separately and docking since launching the whole thing and then landing more than one of the craft on a planet could incur the wrath of the nullreferenceexception bug.

Shryq, do you think you could scale the ranger down another 10% and maybe add some hidden RCS thrusters in the main body to help with forward/backward translation? That'd make docking a lot more intuitive.

I was actually thinking about doing that. I can hide The RCS on the inside. Right near the center of gravity, and then turn down the other RCS to next to nothing.

As far as engine effects go, I was trying to do an emissive for the main engines, but the islands in the UV are so close together, and the resolution so low that I couldn't get a good mapping at all. I could be doing it wrong though. IDK. Benjee how did you get the effects for the main engines on the Endurance?

Since resolution's the issue it might be best to create a new texture for the engines and remap the UVs. The only texturing I did on the engines really was to bake the ambient occlusion and then multiply that over a dark grey colour, which should be pretty simple to do. YOu can just use the 'smart UV project' option for unwrapping. For the emissive on the Endurance engines I just placed lights inside the engine bells and baked the diffuse to a new texture.

I like your pictures.

There has that settled your insecurities?

Now all the ranger needs (for me) is the realistic exhaust (or lack thereof).

Yep. Definately.

- - - Updated - - -

What are you guys doing now? I know that benjee is implementing the lander IVA but...

For the emissive on the Endurance engines I just placed lights inside the engine bells and baked the diffuse to a new texture.

Color me impressed. That's a really smart solution.
